title: Pilgrims Way Walk Route

images.title: Colin Smith / Ranmore Common Bridleway
images.caption: Ranmore Common Bridleway. Leafy dry valley in thick deciduous woodland on top of the North Downs. The pathway is wide and usually firm underfoot because of the underlying flint.

images.title: Chris Whippet / Ruins of Boxley Abbey gateway
images.caption: Ruins of Boxley Abbey gateway. The abbey dates from the 12th century and is located close to the pretty little village of Boxley on the Kent Downs.

images.title: Chris Talbot / Winchester -Front Of Winchester Cathedral
images.caption: Winchester -Front Of Winchester Cathedral

images.title: Oliver Dixon / Horse stile on the Pilgrim's Way
images.caption: Horse stile on the Pilgrims Way near Lenham, Kent

images.title: Rodney Burton / West of Marley Road, Harrietsham, Kent
images.caption: West of Marley Road, Harrietsham, Kent

images.title: Pilgrims' Way millennium stone by don cload, CC BY-SA 2.0 <https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by-sa/2.0>, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Pilgrims Way millennium stone, Itchen Valley

images.title: Peter Trimming / Looking Across to Pewley Down, Surrey
images.caption: Looking Across to Pewley Down, Surrey Photograph taken from the Pilgrims' Way. The bridleway, on Pewley Down, joins the trail about 600 yards to the east of this location.

description: Follow in the footsteps of the pilgrims who followed this ancient track from Winchester in Hampshire, to the shrine of Thomas Becket at Canterbury in Kent. The route runs for over 130 miles with some lovely sections through the Kent Downs AONB and the North Downs. You'll also pass through a series of historic towns and villages with ancient churches and ruined abbeys to explore. For the cycle route that runs from Rochester to Canterbury please see the Pilgrims Way Cycle Route page.
